CountryData.name: Spain
CountryData.description: Spain, officially the Kingdom of Spain, is a country located on the Iberian Peninsula in southwestern Europe. It boasts a diverse landscape ranging from the snow-capped Pyrenees Mountains in the north to the arid deserts of the south. With a rich history, vibrant culture, and stunning natural beauty, Spain is a popular tourist destination and a significant economic power.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Spain is the world's fifth-largest country by area.
quickFacts.detail: This includes mainland Spain and its autonomous cities and islands.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Spain has a large and diverse population.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is approximately 93 people per km².

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Madrid is the political, economic, and cultural center of Spain.
quickFacts.detail: It's known for its grand boulevards, world-class museums, and lively nightlife.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Regional languages like Catalan, Basque, and Galician are also widely spoken.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: Spain uses the Euro as its currency.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Spain has a significant global economy.
quickFacts.detail: It's the sixth-largest economy in Europe.

climateData.title: Climate of Spain
climateData.description: Spain experiences a diverse range of climates due to its varied topography and latitude. Generally, it has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. However, northern Spain has a more temperate oceanic climate, while the Canary Islands enjoy a subtropical climate.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March-May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings pleasant temperatures and blooming wildflowers across much of the country.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June-August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and dry, particularly in the interior and southern regions. Coastal areas offer a refreshing sea breeze.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September-November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn sees a gradual cooling of temperatures and the arrival of rainfall, especially in the north.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December-February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is mild in the south, but colder in the north. Snowfall is common in the Pyrenees and the northern mountains.

naturalWonders.name: Picos de Europa National Park
naturalWonders.description: The Picos de Europa is a stunning mountain range in northern Spain, offering dramatic peaks, deep valleys, and pristine lakes. It's a haven for hikers and nature lovers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This UNESCO World Heritage site is characterized by its limestone cliffs, glacial valleys, and diverse flora and fauna. The park is home to the brown bear, Iberian wolf, and numerous bird species.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before heading out
Bring plenty of water and snacks

naturalWonders.name: Tablas de Daimiel National Park
naturalWonders.description: Tablas de Daimiel is a vast wetland area in Castilla-La Mancha, renowned for its rich biodiversity and importance as a migratory bird sanctuary.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This Ramsar site is characterized by its flooded meadows, reed beds, and numerous lagoons. It's a crucial stopover for migratory birds traveling between Europe and Africa.

naturalWonders.name: Doñana National Park
naturalWonders.description: Doñana is a vast and complex coastal wetland in Andalusia, a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of Europe's most important bird reserves.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This diverse ecosystem includes marshes, lagoons, pine forests, and sandy dunes. It's home to a remarkable variety of wildlife, including Iberian lynx, Spanish imperial eagle, and numerous migratory birds.

ecosystemData.title: Ecosystems of Spain
ecosystemData.overview: Spain’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, reflecting its varied geography and climate. From the Mediterranean scrublands to the boreal forests of the Pyrenees, and the arid landscapes of the Almería region, Spain supports a wide range of habitats and species.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of Spain's land area is protected in national parks, natural parks, and other protected areas.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mediterranean Forests, Woodlands and Scrub
biodiversityCategories.description: This ecosystem dominates much of southern and eastern Spain, characterized by drought-resistant trees and shrubs.

notableSpecies.name: Spanish Imperial Eagle
notableSpecies.significance: Top predator of the Iberian Peninsula

biodiversityCategories.name: Temperate Forests
biodiversityCategories.description: Found in northern Spain, these forests are characterized by deciduous trees and a cooler climate.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Spain
activities.description: Spain offers a vast array of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from challenging mountain treks to relaxing beach days.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Spain's diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: GR Trails
activities.description: The 'Camino de Santiago' is a network of pilgrimage routes offering stunning scenery and cultural experiences.
activities.requirements: Good hiking boots, waterproof clothing, map, compass

activities.name: Picos de Europa Hike
activities.description: Challenge yourself with a multi-day hike through the dramatic Picos de Europa mountains.
activities.requirements: Experienced hiker, appropriate gear, navigation skills

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Mediterranean and Atlantic coasts with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Surfing
activities.description: Spain boasts some of the best surfing waves in Europe.

activities.name: Sailing
activities.description: Explore the Spanish coastline by sailboat.
activities.requirements: Sailboat, sailing experience (depending on boat size)

clothing.winter: Warm layers, waterproof jacket, hat, gloves

equipment.hiking: Hiking boots, trekking poles, map, compass
